string: The Conspirators draw, and kill CORIOLANUS: AUFIDIUS stands on his body
Lords
speaker: Lords

string: Hold, hold, hold, hold!
speaker: Lords

string: AUFIDIUS
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: My noble masters, hear me speak.
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: First Lord
speaker: First Lord

string: O Tullus,--
speaker: First Lord

string: Second Lord
speaker: Second Lord

string: Thou hast done a deed whereat valour will weep.
speaker: Second Lord

string: Third Lord
speaker: Third Lord

string: Tread not upon him. Masters all, be quiet;
speaker: Third Lord

string: Put up your swords.
speaker: Third Lord

string: AUFIDIUS
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: My lords, when you shall know--as in this rage,
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Provoked by him, you cannot--the great danger
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: That he is thus cut off. Please it your honours
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: To call me to your senate, I'll deliver
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Myself your loyal servant, or endure
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Your heaviest censure.
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: First Lord
speaker: First Lord

string: Bear from hence his body;
speaker: First Lord

string: And mourn you for him: let him be regarded
speaker: First Lord

string: As the most noble corse that ever herald
speaker: First Lord

string: Did follow to his urn.
speaker: First Lord

string: Second Lord
speaker: Second Lord

string: His own impatience
speaker: Second Lord

string: Takes from Aufidius a great part of blame.
speaker: Second Lord

string: Let's make the best of it.
speaker: Second Lord

string: AUFIDIUS
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: My rage is gone;
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: And I am struck with sorrow. Take him up.
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Help, three o' the chiefest soldiers; I'll be one.
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Beat thou the drum, that it speak mournfully:
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Trail your steel pikes. Though in this city he
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Hath widow'd and unchilded many a one,
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Which to this hour bewail the injury,
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.
speaker: AUFIDIUS

string: Exeunt, bearing the body of CORIOLANUS. A dead march sounded
